generif.text: The mechanism of interaction of the sweet protein monellin with the T1R2-T1R3 receptor.
sweet and umami taste are strictly dependent on T1R-receptors, and show that selective elimination of T1R-subunits differentially abolishes detection and perception of these two taste modalities
water rinses remove the inhibitor from the heteromeric sweetener receptor TAS1R2-TAS1R3, which activates cells and results in the perception of strong sweetness from pure water
Some of the amino acid positions crucial for activation of hTAS1R2+hTAS1R3 by neohesperidin dihydrochalcone are involved in the binding of allosteric modulators in other class C GPCRs
Interactions between the human sweet-sensing T1R2-T1R3 receptor and sweeteners detected by saturation transfer difference NMR spectroscopy.
Data show that Positive allosteric modulators of the sweet taste receptor could help reduce the caloric content in food and beverages while maintaining the desired taste.
Results from mutagenesis and chimeras of the receptor indicated that brazzein interacts with both T1R2 and T1R3 and that the Venus flytrap module of T1R2 is important for brazzein agonism.

significant associations were seen in TAS1R2 for caries risk and/or protection.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
Our findings show that a genetic variation in TAS1R2 affects habitual consumption of sugars and may contribute to interindividual differences in changing behaviors in response to dietary counseling.
T1R2/T1R3 is involved in glucose-dependent secretion of satiation peptides
Genetic ablation of the sweet TR protein T1R2 obliterates fructose-induced insulin release and its potentiating effects on glucose-stimulated insulin secretion in vitro and in vivo.
associated with caries risk

Interaction between brazzein and the amino terminal domain of the sweet receptor subunit T1R2 showed a stronger interaction at 7 degrees C than at 37 degrees C.; the low temperature conformation, alters the orientations of 2 loops known to be critical for the sweetness of brazzein, may represent the bound state of brazzei in the complex with the human sweet receptor.
effects of artificial sweeteners on adipose tissue may be largely independent of the classical sweet taste receptors, T1R2 and T1R3
human and mouse membrane trafficking systems for sweet taste receptors T1r2 and T1r3
high-risk caries experience (>8 caries) was found to be associated with TAS1R2 rs35874116 homozygous polymorphic genotype.

no significant associations between GLUT2 and/or TAS1R2 polymorphisms and fillings were found, but allele frequencies of the TAS1R2 variant were marginally significantly different between children with DMFT = 0 and DMFT >/=1. no significant interaction between both genes and risk of dental caries was found. GLUT2 and TASR1 polymorphisms may influence the risk of caries in the Czech population
The rs12033832 single nucleotide polymorphism in TAS1R2 is associated with sucrose taste and sugar intake, but the effect differs depending on BMI
In conclusion, the Val/Val genotype of TAS1R2 was associated with a higher carbohydrate intake and HTG.
The molecular anatomy of sweet taste receptor dimers T1R2-T1R3 has been presented.

We observe that binding of agonists to VFD2 of TAS1R2 leads to major conformational changes to form a TM6/TM6 interface between TMDs of TAS1R2 and TAS1R3, which is consistent with the activation process observed biophysically on the metabotropic glutamate receptor 2 homodimer.

Alleles from each TAS1R2 locus (GG compared with AA alleles of rs12033832, and CT/CC compared with TT alleles of rs35874116) were related to higher consumption of carbohydrates (% energy) and higher amount of sweet foods, respectively (P<0.05).

genetic association studies in population of preschool-aged children in Guelph, Ontario: Data suggest that SNPs in CD36 (rs1761667), TAS1R2 (rs35874116), and TAS2R38 (rs713598) are associated with snacking behavior in the population studied. [PILOT PROJECTS]

The data further reveal that the C terminus of the extracellular cysteine-rich domain needs to be properly folded for T1R3 dimerization and co-trafficking, but not for surface expression of T1R2 alone. These results guided the modeling of the T1R2-T1R3 dimer in living cells.

The Ile191Val is a partial loss-of-function variant of the TAS1R2 sweet-taste receptor and is associated with reduced glucose excursions in humans.

reactome.name: Sensory perception of sweet, bitter, and umami (glutamate) taste
Sensory perception of sweet, bitter, and umami (glutamate) taste

summary: Contributes to sweet taste receptor activity. Involved in detection of chemical stimulus involved in sensory perception of sweet taste and positive regulation of cytokinesis. Part of sweet taste receptor complex. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
